title: Git lifecycle
description: Assume you need to work on a project where the code is in a GitHub Repository. The recommendation is changing code in your workstation and then publish changes to GitHub for review and merge. I recommend a 10 easy steps process to follow to reduce the chance of having bugs in code as well as reduce the chance of git merge conflict. I divide these steps to 2 parts work on local repository - Part 2: work on GitHub UI
